data.additional_notes:
#### SDHQ's Build Score Breakdown


Hogwarts Legacy is the Harry Potter video game players have been asking for. Given some time, I can see this game shining as brightly as a wand casting Lumos on the Steam Deck.
- **Performance:** ★★★☆☆ (3/5))
- **Visuals:** ★★★★☆ (4/5)
- **Stability:** ★★☆☆☆ (2/5)
- **Controls:** ★★★★☆ (4/5)
- **Battery:** ★★★☆☆ (3/5)


https://youtu.be/xgpQG7P-P2I

reports_summary: Most submissions indicate Hogwarts Legacy feels mixed on handhelds: the Steam Deck OLED reaches 60 FPS when render resolution is cut and an aggressive upscaler is used, giving around five hours of battery, while the ROG Ally Z1 Extreme sits in the mid‑30s at higher fidelity and runs much shorter sessions—roughly one to one and a half hours. The community agrees the practical route is to drop presets or use an upscaler (or frame‑generation patches) to trade visual quality for steadier frame pacing and longer playtime.
